snippet: The election of Melissa Mark-Viverito as speaker of the City Council marked another swift and sharp shift in New York City’s political landscape.
abstract: New York City Council unanimously elects Melissa Mark-Viverito, fiercely liberal Democrat from East Harlem, as its powerful speaker, eschewing moderate leadership that had overseen its ranks for a decade; her election represents early and significant victory for Mayor Bill de Blasio and eliminates the last barrier to a government fully in line with the undiluted liberalism embraced by the new mayor.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: The election of Melissa Mark-Viverito as speaker of the City Council marked another swift and sharp shift in New York City’s political landscape.

headline.main: Mayoral Ally Elected Speaker, Furthering City’s Liberal Shift
headline.print_headline: Mayoral Ally Elected Speaker, Furthering City’s Liberal Shift
